LanguageData.RN_MRE_USArmy.label: MRE US Army
LanguageData.RN_MRE_USArmy.description: Meal Ready to Eat. A high-quality packaged meal, manufactured for use in survival situations. While it never rots, it can still deteriorate if left outside. Great for traveling.
LanguageData.RNMedicine_IFAK_Multicam.label: IFAK
LanguageData.RNMedicine_IFAK_Multicam.description: Individual First Aid Kit. A kit of industrial-era medical equipment. It contains basic drugs, tools for suturing and bone setting, diagnostic devices, and various pads and fluids.
LanguageData.RNMedicine_MedicBag.label: medic bag
LanguageData.RNMedicine_MedicBag.description: A medic bag for paramedic use. A kit of industrial-era medical equipment. It contains basic drugs, tools for suturing and bone setting, diagnostic devices, various pads, various fluids and other specialist equipment for dealing with a variety of ailments.
LanguageData.RH_Tactical_GermanShepherd.label: german shepherd
LanguageData.RH_Tactical_GermanShepherd.description: Said to be the most intelligent and loyal dog ever, the German Shepherd or Alsatian is a working dog breed with good combat capabilities.
LanguageData.RH_Tactical_GermanShepherd.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.RH_Tactical_GermanShepherd.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.RH_Tactical_GermanShepherd.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.RNApparel_511TacTec_Ghost.label: 5.11 Tactec body armor (Ghosts)
LanguageData.RNApparel_511TacTec_Ghost.description:
The 5.11 company introduces TACTEC Plate Carrier. Initially marketed as weight vests to crossfitters, 5.11 found a way to sell the TacTec plate carriers to people who won't spend a moment in combat by convincing them that it's better to buy this plate carrier which costs hundreds of dollars (That's without the ballistic plates, by the way.) than to wear something else with weight.
Operators in the field who can't afford Crye Precision gear choose this alternative due to it's ergonomic and lightweight capabilities. The extra weight from the operator's wallet disappeared thanks to 5.11.
LanguageData.RNApparel_FASTHelmet_Keegan.label: FAST helmet Keegan
LanguageData.RNApparel_FASTHelmet_Keegan.description:
With its revolutionary ergonomic shell geometry, FAST is Ops-Core's most advanced line of helmets, providing the highest level of ballistic protection at the lightest weight.
Designed for combat operations, these shells provide different ballistic protection levels and cuts to suit the range of mission and comms needs.
LanguageData.RNApparel_PTABravoHelmet_Grim.label: PT A-Bravo helmet Grim
LanguageData.RNApparel_PTABravoHelmet_Grim.descriptio:
The Pro-Tec A-Bravo, a series of helmets produced by the Pro-Tec company which originally designed sports helmets.
This specific model is unavailable for public purchase during the modern era, only available for the U.S. Department of Defense to purchase in bulk for the U.S. Military or police. According to the website: "FOR U.S. MILITARY and FEDERAL DEPT ONLY. ORDERS WILL NOT BE ACCEPTED BY ANY OTHER PERSONNEL AT THIS TIME. MADE IN USA."
LanguageData.RNApparel_MICHHelmet_Hesh.label: MICH helmet Hesh
LanguageData.RNApparel_MICHHelmet_Hesh.description: The Modular Integrated Communications Helmet (MICH) is a U.S. combat helmet and one of several used by the U.S. military. It was developed by the United States Army Soldier Systems Center to be the next generation of protective combat helmets for use by the U.S. Army.
LanguageData.RNApparel_MICHHelmet_Ajax.label: MICH helmet Ajax
LanguageData.RNApparel_MICHHelmet_Ajax.description: The Modular Integrated Communications Helmet (MICH) is a U.S. combat helmet and one of several used by the U.S. military. It was developed by the United States Army Soldier Systems Center to be the next generation of protective combat helmets for use by the U.S. Army.
LanguageData.RNApparel_Backpack_Tactical_SlingBlack.d:
A backpack for carrying things.. Tactically. Perfect for occassions where you can't help but show off the new kit to the third world tribals. This time as a sling AND it's black!
Sure it's a bit more impractical to carry heavy stuff over one shoulder, but who cares? You look freakin' tactical as frick bro, especially now that it's black!
LanguageData.RNApparel_ATACSLEXBoonie.label: boonie hat A-TACS LE-X
LanguageData.RNApparel_ATACSLEXBoonie.description: A boonie hat, also known as giggle hat, is a form of wide-brim hat commonly used by military forces. Its design is similar to a bucket hat but with a stiffer brim. Has A-TACS LE-X camo.
LanguageData.RNApparel_Balaclava_Hunter.label: balaclava Hunter
LanguageData.RNApparel_Balaclava_Hunter.description: An artistically terrifying ghost balaclava. Hides the wearer's face and makes them more confident.
LanguageData.RNApparel_Balaclava_Logan.label: balaclava Logan
LanguageData.RNApparel_Balaclava_Logan.description: An artistically terrifying ghost balaclava. Hides the wearer's face and makes them more confident.
LanguageData.RNApparel_Balaclava_Merrick.label: balaclava Merrick
LanguageData.RNApparel_Balaclava_Merrick.description: An artistically terrifying ghost balaclava. Hides the wearer's face and makes them more confident.
LanguageData.RNApparel_Balaclava_Spook.label: balaclava Spook
LanguageData.RNApparel_Balaclava_Spook.description: An artistically terrifying ghost balaclava. Hides the wearer's face and makes them more confident.
LanguageData.RNApparel_Balaclava_Wraith.label: balaclava Wraith
LanguageData.RNApparel_Balaclava_Wraith.description: An artistically terrifying ghost balaclava. Hides the wearer's face and makes them more confident.
LanguageData.RNApparel_combats_ATACSLEX.description:
A combat uniform, field uniform, or battledress, is a type of uniform used in combat, as opposed to dress uniforms worn in functions and parades. In American English, the term fatigues is often used, originally being a term for soldiers' work uniforms.
The combat uniform is generally camouflaged, either in monochrome such as a shade of green or brown to approximate the background, or in a disruptive pattern.
LanguageData.RNApparel_combats_ATACSLEX.label: combat uniform A-TACS LE-X
LanguageData.RNApparel_combats_SmockATACSLEX.descript: Custom made, windproof coveralls with a hoodie for cold weather. It's also designed to reduce flammability for the wearer
LanguageData.RNApparel_combats_SmockATACSLEX.label: coveralls A-TACS LE-X
LanguageData.RNApparel_Parka_ATACSLEX.label: parka A-TACS LE-X
LanguageData.RNApparel_Parka_ATACSLEX.description: A parka for staying warm in even the coldest of temperatures. Has the A-TACS LE-X camo.
LanguageData.RN_BallisticKnife_Blade.label: ballistic knife blade

LanguageData.RNEx_M320GL.label: M320
LanguageData.RNEx_M320GL.description: M320 Grenade Launcher Module (GLM) is the U.S. military's designation for a new single-shot 40 mm grenade launcher system to replace the M203 for the U.S. Army, while other services initially kept using the older M203. The M320 uses the same High-Low Propulsion System as the M203.
LanguageData.RNEx_M320GL.tools.0.label: barrel
LanguageData.RNBullet_40mmGrenade.label: 40x46mm grenade round
LanguageData.RNGun_M240B.label: M240B
LanguageData.RNGun_M240B.description: The M240, officially the Machine Gun, 7.62 mm, M240, is the US military designation for the FN MAG ("Mitrailleuse A Gaz" = Gas operated machine gun; alternatively, "Mitrailleuse d'Appui General" = machine gun, support, general) a family of belt-fed, gas-operated medium machine guns that chamber the 7.62×51mm NATO cartridge.
LanguageData.RNGun_M240B.tools.0.label: stock
LanguageData.RNGun_M240B.tools.1.label: barrel
LanguageData.RNGun_MK48LMG.label: Mk 48
LanguageData.RNGun_MK48LMG.description:
The Mark 48, or Mk 48 is a lightweight belt-fed machine gun, firing 7.62×51mm NATO cartridges from a disintegrating belt of ammunition.
It is manufactured by Fabrique Nationale Manufacturing, Inc., a division of FN Herstal based in the United States. The Mk 48 has been developed in conjunction with the U.S. Special Operations Command (USSOCOM), which has adopted the weapon and started its fielding process, beginning with special operations units.
LanguageData.RNGun_MK48LMG.tools.0.label: stock
LanguageData.RNGun_MK48LMG.tools.1.label: barrel
LanguageData.RNGun_M249LMG.label: M249
LanguageData.RNGun_M249LMG.description: The M249 light machine gun (LMG), formerly designated the M249 Squad Automatic Weapon (SAW) and formally written as Light Machine Gun, 5.56 mm, M249, is the American adaptation of the Belgian FN Minimi, a light machine gun manufactured by the Belgian company FN Herstal (FN).
LanguageData.RNGun_M249LMG.tools.0.label: stock
LanguageData.RNGun_M249LMG.tools.1.label: barrel
LanguageData.RNGun_M107AMR.label: M107
LanguageData.RNGun_M107AMR.description:
The Barrett M82, standardized by the U.S. military as the M107, is a recoil-operated, semi-automatic anti-materiel sniper system developed by the American Barrett Firearms Manufacturing company. Despite its designation as an anti-materiel rifle, it is used by some armed forces as an anti-personnel system.
It is also called the Light Fifty for its .50 BMG (12.7×99mm NATO) chambering and significantly lighter weight compared to previous applications.
LanguageData.RNGun_M107AMR.tools.0.label: stock
LanguageData.RNGun_M107AMR.tools.1.label: barrel
LanguageData.RNGun_HK417DMR.label: HK417
LanguageData.RNGun_HK417DMR.description:
The Heckler and Koch HK417 is a battle rifle designed and manufactured by Heckler and Koch in Germany. It is the larger caliber version of the HK416, and chambered for the full-power 7.62×51mm NATO rifle cartridge. It is a gas-operated, selective fire rifle with a rotating bolt.
The HK417 is intended for use in roles where the greater penetrative power, stopping power, and range of the 7.62×51mm cartridge are required.
LanguageData.RNGun_HK417DMR.tools.0.label: stock
LanguageData.RNGun_HK417DMR.tools.1.label: barrel
LanguageData.RNGun_M14EBRMilSpec.label: M14 EBR MIL-SPEC
LanguageData.RNGun_M14EBRMilSpec.description:
The M14 rifle, officially the United States Rifle, 7.62 mm, M14, is an American automatic rifle that fires 7.62×51mm NATO (.308 in) ammunition.
It became the standard-issued rifle for the U.S. military in 1959 replacing the M1 Garand rifle in the U.S. Army by 1961 and the U.S. Marine Corps by 1965 until being replaced by the M16 rifle beginning in 1964.
LanguageData.RNGun_M14EBRMilSpec.tools.0.label: stock
LanguageData.RNGun_M14EBRMilSpec.tools.1.label: barrel
LanguageData.RNGun_M39EMRMilSpec.label: M39 EMR MIL-SPEC
LanguageData.RNGun_M39EMRMilSpec.description:
The M39 Enhanced Marksman Rifle is a semi-automatic, gas-operated designated marksman rifle chambered for the 7.62×51mm NATO cartridge. It is a modified and accurized version of the M14 rifle used by the United States military, in a similar vein to the Mk 14 Enhanced Battle Rifle. It is based on the United States Marine Corps Designated Marksman Rifle (DMR), which it replaced.
It is manufactured by Sage International and maintained by the USMC's Precision Weapons Section.
LanguageData.RNGun_M39EMRMilSpec.tools.0.label: stock
LanguageData.RNGun_M39EMRMilSpec.tools.1.label: barrel
LanguageData.RNGun_VSSDMRMaverick.label: VSS Vintorez Maverick
LanguageData.RNGun_VSSDMRMaverick.description:
The VSS (Russian: Винтовка Снайперская Специальная, Vintovka Snayperskaya Spetsialnaya or "Special Sniper Rifle", GRAU designation 6P29), also called the Vintorez ("thread cutter"/"tap"), is a suppressed sniper rifle that uses a heavy subsonic 9×39mm SP5 cartridge and armor-piercing SP6 cartridge.
It was developed in the late 1980s by TsNIITochMash and manufactured by the Tula Arsenal. It is issued primarily to Spetsnaz units for undercover or clandestine operations, a role made evident by its ability to be stripped down for transport in a specially fitted briefcase
LanguageData.RNGun_VSSDMRMaverick.tools.0.label: stock
LanguageData.RNGun_VSSDMRMaverick.tools.1.label: barrel
LanguageData.RNGun_AKMTacticalAR.label: AKM Tactical
LanguageData.RNGun_AKMTacticalAR.description:
The AKM (Russian: модернизи́рованный Автома́т Кала́шникова, tr. modernizírovanny Avtomát Kaláshnikova, lit. Modernized Kalashnikov Automatic Rifle) is a 7.62mm assault rifle designed by Mikhail Kalashnikov. It is a common modernized variant of the AK-47 rifle developed in the 1940s.
Introduced into service with the Soviet Army in 1959, the AKM is the most ubiquitous variant of the entire AK series of firearms and it has found widespread use with most member states of the former Warsaw Pact and its African and Asian allies as well as being widely exported and produced in many other countries.
It was officially replaced in Soviet frontline service by the AK-74 in the late 1970s, but remains in use worldwide.
LanguageData.RNGun_AKMTacticalAR.tools.0.label: stock
LanguageData.RNGun_AKMTacticalAR.tools.1.label: barrel
LanguageData.RNGun_M27IAR.label: M27 IAR
LanguageData.RNGun_M27IAR.description:
The M27 Infantry Automatic Rifle (IAR) is a lightweight, magazine-fed 5.56mm, select-fire weapon based on the Heckler and Koch HK416. It is used by the United States Marine Corps and is intended to enhance an automatic rifleman's maneuverability.
In December 2017, the Marine Corps revealed a decision to equip every Marine in an infantry squad with the M27.
LanguageData.RNGun_M27IAR.tools.0.label: stock
LanguageData.RNGun_M27IAR.tools.1.label: barrel
LanguageData.RNGun_M27IAR_SD.label: M27 IAR SD
LanguageData.RNGun_M27IAR_SD.description:
The M27 Infantry Automatic Rifle (IAR) is a lightweight, magazine-fed 5.56mm, select-fire weapon based on the Heckler and Koch HK416. It is used by the United States Marine Corps and is intended to enhance an automatic rifleman's maneuverability.
In December 2017, the Marine Corps revealed a decision to equip every Marine in an infantry squad with the M27.
LanguageData.RNGun_M27IAR_SD.tools.0.label: stock
LanguageData.RNGun_M27IAR_SD.tools.1.label: barrel
LanguageData.RNGun_HK416SD_DEVGRU.label: HK416 SD DEVGRU
LanguageData.RNGun_HK416SD_DEVGRU.description:
The Heckler and Koch HK416 is an assault rifle designed and manufactured by Heckler and Koch. Although its design is in large part based on the AR-15 class of weapons, specifically the Colt M4 carbine family issued to the U.S. military, it uses an HK-proprietary short-stroke gas piston system originally derived from the ArmaLite AR-18 (the same system was also used in Heckler and Koch's earlier G36 family of rifles).
It is the standard assault rifle of the French Armed Forces and Norwegian Armed Forces, and was the weapon used by SEAL Team Six to kill Osama Bin Laden in 2011.
LanguageData.RNGun_HK416SD_DEVGRU.tools.0.label: stock
LanguageData.RNGun_HK416SD_DEVGRU.tools.1.label: barrel
LanguageData.RNGun_M4A1MilSpec.label: M4A1 MIL-SPEC
LanguageData.RNGun_M4A1MilSpec.description:
The M4 carbine is a shorter and lighter variant of the M16A2 assault rifle. The M4 is a 5.56×45mm NATO, air-cooled, direct impingement gas-operated, magazine-fed carbine. It has a 14.5 in (370 mm) barrel and a telescoping stock.
The M4 carbine is extensively used by the United States Armed Forces and is largely replacing the M16 rifle in United States Army and United States Marine Corps combat units as the primary infantry weapon and service rifle.
LanguageData.RNGun_M4A1MilSpec.tools.0.label: stock
LanguageData.RNGun_M4A1MilSpec.tools.1.label: barrel
LanguageData.RNGun_M4A1MilSpecSD.label: M4A1 SD MIL-SPEC
LanguageData.RNGun_M4A1MilSpecSD.description:
The M4 carbine is a shorter and lighter variant of the M16A2 assault rifle. The M4 is a 5.56×45mm NATO, air-cooled, direct impingement gas-operated, magazine-fed carbine. It has a 14.5 in (370 mm) barrel and a telescoping stock.
The M4 carbine is extensively used by the United States Armed Forces and is largely replacing the M16 rifle in United States Army and United States Marine Corps combat units as the primary infantry weapon and service rifle.
LanguageData.RNGun_M4A1MilSpecSD.tools.0.label: stock
LanguageData.RNGun_M4A1MilSpecSD.tools.1.label: barrel
LanguageData.RNGun_M16A4MilSpec.label: M16A4 MIL-SPEC
LanguageData.RNGun_M16A4MilSpec.description:
The M16 rifle, officially designated Rifle, Caliber 5.56 mm, M16, is a United States military adaptation of the ArmaLite AR-15 rifle. The original M16 was a 5.56mm automatic rifle with a 20-round magazine.
In 1964, the M16 entered U.S. military service and the following year was deployed for jungle warfare operations during the Vietnam War. In 1969, the M16A1 replaced the M14 rifle to become the U.S. military's standard service rifle.
LanguageData.RNGun_M16A4MilSpec.tools.0.label: stock
LanguageData.RNGun_M16A4MilSpec.tools.1.label: barrel
LanguageData.RNGun_HoneyBadgerGhosts_PDW.label: AAC Honey Badger Ghost
LanguageData.RNGun_HoneyBadgerGhosts_PDW.description: The AAC Honey Badger is an integrally suppressed personal defense weapon based on the AR-15. It is chambered in .300 AAC Blackout and produced by Advanced Armament Corporation (AAC), a subsidiary of Remington Outdoor Company. The weapon is named after the honey badger.
LanguageData.RNGun_MP5A3SD_PDW.label: MP5A3 SD
LanguageData.RNGun_MP5A3SD_PDW.description:
The MP5 (German: Maschinenpistole 5) is a 9mm submachine gun, developed in the 1960s by a team of engineers from the German small arms manufacturer Heckler and Koch GmbH (HK) of Oberndorf am Neckar. There are over 100 variants of the MP5, including some semi-automatic versions.
The MP5 is one of the most widely used submachine guns in the world, having been adopted by 40 nations and numerous military, law enforcement, intelligence, and security organizations. It is widely used by SWAT teams in North America.
In 1999, Heckler and Koch developed the Heckler and Koch UMP, the MP5's successor
LanguageData.RNGun_MP5A3SD_PDW.tools.0.label: grip
LanguageData.RNGun_MP5A3SD_PDW.tools.1.label: barrel
